The system validates the AST data generated through AI function calling, provides feedback to the AI for correction when errors are detected, and finally converts the validated AST data into actual programming code."]}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"className":"x:not-first:mt-6 x:leading-7","children":["Therefore, the success of ",["$","code",null,{"className":"nextra-code","dir":"ltr","children":"@autobe"}]," depends on three critical factors. First, how precisely and efficiently we can create AI function calling schemas. Second, how detailed and accurate validation feedback we can provide to the AI when it generates incorrect AST data. Finally, how clearly we can communicate the coding rules that ",["$","code",null,{"className":"nextra-code","dir":"ltr","children":"@autobe"}]," must follow while constructing code (composing AST data) to the AI."]}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"className":"x:not-first:mt-6 x:leading-7","children":["To address these challenges, ",["$","code",null,{"className":"nextra-code","dir":"ltr","children":"@autobe"}]," adopts ",["$","a",null,{"href":"https://github.com/samchon/typia","target":"_blank","rel":"noreferrer","className":"x:focus-visible:nextra-focus x:text-primary-600 x:underline x:hover:no-underline x:decoration-from-font x:[text-underline-position:from-font]","children":[["$","code",null,{"className":"nextra-code","dir":"ltr","children":"typia"}],false]}]," to generate AI function calling schemas at the compiler level. The compiler integrated with ",["$","a",null,{"href":"https://github.com/samchon/typia","target":"_blank","rel":"noreferrer","className":"x:focus-visible:nextra-focus x:text-primary-600 x:underline x:hover:no-underline x:decoration-from-font x:[text-underline-position:from-font]","children":[["$","code",null,{"className":"nextra-code","dir":"ltr","children":"typia"}],false]}]," not only creates AI function calling schemas but also generates validation functions for each type. Moreover, the coding rules that ",["$","code",null,{"className":"nextra-code","dir":"ltr","children":"@autobe"}]," must follow are embedded as comments in each AST type. These comments are recorded as type descriptions when ",["$","a",null,{"href":"https://github.com/samchon/typia","target":"_blank","rel":"noreferrer","className":"x:focus-visible:nextra-focus x:text-primary-600 x:underline x:hover:no-underline x:decoration-from-font x:[text-underline-position:from-font]","children":[["$","code",null,{"className":"nextra-code","dir":"ltr","children":"typia"}],false]}]," converts TypeScript types into AI function calling schemas."]}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"className":"x:not-first:mt-6 x:leading-7","children":"This approach creates a comprehensive development story that ensures both type safety and rule compliance through compiler-driven automation."}],"\n",["$","h2",null,{"id":"schema-made-by-compiler","className":"x:tracking-tight x:text-slate-900 x:dark:text-slate-100 x:font-semibold x:leading-7","children":"AST (Abstract Syntax Tree) structures are inherently recursive with infinite depth and countless union types. Therefore, creating AI function calling schemas for AST should never be done manually. It must be automatically generated by a compiler to ensure both stability and productivity."}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"className":"x:not-first:mt-6 x:leading-7","children":["The ",["$","a",null,{"href":"https://typia.io/docs/llm/application/","target":"_blank","rel":"noreferrer","className":"x:focus-visible:nextra-focus x:text-primary-600 x:underline x:hover:no-underline x:decoration-from-font x:[text-underline-position:from-font]","children":[["$","code",null,{"className":"nextra-code","dir":"ltr","children":"typia.llm.application<App, Model, Options>()"}],false]}]," function serves as the cornerstone of this approach. This powerful utility automatically generates comprehensive AI function calling schemas from TypeScript type definitions. By leveraging compile-time type analysis, it creates schemas that are not only type-safe but also include rich metadata and validation rules embedded directly in the type system."]}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"className":"x:not-first:mt-6 x:leading-7","children":"The function supports multiple AI models through its generic parameters, allowing for model-specific optimizations and feature support. The options parameter enables fine-tuning of schema generation, including reference handling, description enrichment, and validation strictness. This compiler-driven approach eliminates the manual effort and potential errors associated with hand-crafted schemas while providing superior type safety and maintainability."}],"\n",["$","h2",null,{"id":"comments-over-prompts","className":"x:tracking-tight x:text-slate-900 x:dark:text-slate-100 x:font-semibold x:target:animate-[fade-in_1.5s] x:mt-10 In contrast, description information written in function calling schemas is reliably followed by AI models. When AI generates information for a type specified through function calling, it references the typeâ€™s description information again, making type-level comments far more effective than system prompts in coding agents."}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"className":"x:not-first:mt-6 x:leading-7","children":["The ",["$","$L1a",null,{"href":"/api/interfaces/_autobe_interface.AutoBePrisma.IFile.html","className":"x:focus-visible:nextra-focus x:text-primary-600 x:underline x:hover:no-underline x:decoration-from-font x:[text-underline-position:from-font]","children":["$","code",null,{"className":"nextra-code","dir":"ltr","children":"AutoBePrisma.IFile"}]}]," and ",["$","$L1a",null,{"href":"/api/interfaces/_autobe_interface.AutoBePrisma.IModel.html","className":"x:focus-visible:nextra-focus x:text-primary-600 x:underline x:hover:no-underline x:decoration-from-font x:[text-underline-position:from-font]","children":["$","code",null,{"className":"nextra-code","dir":"ltr","children":"AutoBePrisma.IModel"}]}]," types exemplify this approach by meticulously documenting the rules that must be followed for each interface and property type. For example, the ",["$","code",null,{"className":"nextra-code","dir":"ltr","children":"filename"}]," property must follow the ",["$","code",null,{"className":"nextra-code","dir":"ltr","children":"schema-{number}-{domain}.prisma"}]," format, and when defining database models, the name property must use snake_case convention with domain prefixes like ",["$","code",null,{"className":"nextra-code","dir":"ltr","children":"shopping_customers"}]," or ",["$","code",null,{"className":"nextra-code","dir":"ltr","children":"bbs_articles"}],". Each comment provides concrete examples and specific constraints that guide the AI toward generating compliant code structures."]}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"className":"x:not-first:mt-6 x:leading-7","children":"This comment-driven approach ensures that coding rules are embedded directly where the AI encounters them during code generation, creating a more reliable and maintainable system than traditional prompt-based instruction methods."}],"\n",["$","h2",null,{"id":"validation-feedback","className":"x:tracking-tight x:text-slate-900 x:dark:text-slate-100 x:font-semibold x:target:animate-[fade-in_1.5s] x:mt-10 x:border-b x:pb-1 x:text-3xl nextra-border","children":["Validation Feedback",["$","$L24",null,{"id":"validation-feedback"}]]}],"\n",["$","$L26",null,{"items":[["$","code",null,{"className":"nextra-code","dir":"ltr","children":"ILlmApplication"}],["$","code",null,{"className":"nextra-code","dir":"ltr","children":"ILlmFunction"}],["$","code",null,{"className":"nextra-code","dir":"ltr","children":"IValidation"}]],"defaultIndex":1,"children":[["$","$L27",null,{"children":[["$","h3",null,{"id":"-3","style":{"visibility":"hidden","width":0,"height":0},"children":"undefined"}],"$L2c"]}],["$","$L27",null,{"children":[["$","h3",null,{"id":"-4","style":{"visibility":"hidden","width":0,"height":0},"children":"undefined"}],"$L2d"]}],["$","$L27",null,{"children":[["$","h3",null,{"id":"-5","style":{"visibility":"hidden","width":0,"height":0},"children":"undefined"}],"$L2e"]}]]}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"className":"x:not-first:mt-6 x:leading-7","children":"Does AI function calling always produce type-valid AST data? The answer is no. AI frequently experiences hallucinations even during function calling, generating AST data that is not type-valid. To correct these AI errors, validation feedback must be provided back to the AI."}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"className":"x:not-first:mt-6 x:leading-7","children":["The ",["$","a",null,{"href":"https://typia.io/docs/llm/application/","target":"_blank","rel":"noreferrer","className":"x:focus-visible:nextra-focus x:text-primary-600 x:underline x:hover:no-underline x:decoration-from-font x:[text-underline-position:from-font]","children":[["$","code",null,{"className":"nextra-code","dir":"ltr","children":"typia.llm.application<App, Model, Options>()"}],false]}]," function used by ",["$","code",null,{"className":"nextra-code","dir":"ltr","children":"@autobe"}]," to create AI function calling schemas for AST data includes a built-in runtime type checker specialized for AI validation feedback. This validator doesnâ€™t just identify type violations; it generates detailed, AI-friendly error messages that help the model understand exactly what went wrong and how to fix it."]}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"className":"x:not-first:mt-6 x:leading-7","children":["Even when AI function calling produces AST data that is type-correct, there are cases where the data fails to follow ",["$","code",null,{"className":"nextra-code","dir":"ltr","children":"@autobe"}],"â€™s coding rules or contains contradictions that make conversion to programming code impossible. In these scenarios, ",["$","code",null,{"className":"nextra-code","dir":"ltr","children":"@autobe"}],"â€™s custom-developed compilerâ€™s built-in compilation feedback feature activates to assist in AI correction."]}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"className":"x:not-first:mt-6 x:leading-7","children":"This dual-layer validation system ensures that both type safety and business rule compliance are maintained throughout the code generation process. The compiler-level feedback provides semantic validation beyond simple type checking, catching logical inconsistencies and rule violations that could lead to non-functional generated code."}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"className":"x:not-first:mt-6 x:leading-7","children":["By combining runtime type validation with semantic rule validation, ",["$","code",null,{"className":"nextra-code","dir":"ltr","children":"@autobe"}]," creates a robust feedback loop that continuously improves AI output quality while maintaining the integrity of the generated codebase. This approach transforms potential AI hallucinations from fatal errors into learning opportunities, allowing the system to iteratively refine its output until it meets all requirements."]}]]}]]}]]}]}]

*"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"   * - **Main Entity Types**: Use `IEntityName` format for main *"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"   *   - `IEntityName.ICreate`: Request body for creation operations *"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":[["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     * Note that, combination of This ensures consistency and reusability across"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     * the API."}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     *"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     * ## Type Naming Conventions in Components"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     *"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     * When defining schema components, follow these standardized naming"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     * patterns for consistency and clarity:"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     *"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     * ### Main Entity Types"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     *"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     * - `IEntityName`"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     *"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     *   - *"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"   * In OpenAPI, this might *"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"   * *"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"   * Authorization: Bearer Examples"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     * include \"$input.member.age\", \"$input.categories[0]\","}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     * \"$input.user.profile.email\""}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     */"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":[["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#E36209","--shiki-dark":"#FFAB70"},"children":"    path"}],["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#D73A49","--shiki-dark":"#F97583"},"children":":"}],["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#005CC5","--shiki-dark":"#79B8FF"},"children":" string"}],["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#24292E","--shiki-dark":"#E1E4E8"},"children":";"}]]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":" "}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"    /**"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     * The expected type name or type expression"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     *"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     * Technical type specification that describes what type was expected at"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     * this path. * values."}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     */"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":[["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#E36209","--shiki-dark":"#FFAB70"},"children":"    value"}],["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#D73A49","--shiki-dark":"#F97583"},"children":":"}],["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#005CC5","--shiki-dark":"#79B8FF"},"children":" "}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"    /**"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     * Optional human-readable description of the validation *"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     * This field is rarely populated in standard typia validation   *"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     *    - Add a `body` property containing the request body *"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     * **AI Decision *"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     * - Set to meaningful variable name when the response contains *"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     * Variable naming should follow business domain conventions */"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":[["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#E36209","--shiki-dark":"#FFAB70"},"children":"    variableName"}],["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#D73A49","--shiki-dark":"#F97583"},"children":"?:"}],["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#24292E","--shiki-dark":"#E1E4E8"},"children":" *"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     * - `==` (loose equality) - This is NOT supported and causes *"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     * **âœ… ALWAYS use strict equality *"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     * - `===` (strict equality) - Use this for all equality *"}]}],"\n",["$","span",null,{"children":["$","span",null,{"style":{"--shiki-light":"#6A737D","--shiki-dark":"#6A737D"},"children":"     * AI selection strategy: Choose counts that reflect realistic
